slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | मय्यासक्तमनाः पार्थ योगं युञ्जन्मदाश्रयः | असंशयं समग्रं मां यथा ज्ञास्यसि तच्छृणु ||
slokas.pronunciation: śhrī bhagavān uvācha | mayyāsakta-manāḥ pārtha yogaṁ yuñjan mad-āśhrayaḥ | asanśhayaṁ samagraṁ māṁ yathā jñāsyasi tach chhṛiṇu ||
slokas.meaning: The Supreme Lord said: O Partha (Arjuna), now hear how you shall know Me completely, without doubt, by practicing yoga with full consciousness of Me, with your mind attached to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: ज्ञानं तेऽहं सविज्ञानमिदं वक्ष्याम्यशेषतः | यज्ज्ञात्वा नेह भूयोऽन्यज्ज्ञातव्यमवशिष्यते ||
slokas.pronunciation: jñānaṁ te 'haṁ sa-vijñānam idaṁ vakṣhyāmyaśheṣhataḥ | yaj jñātvā neha bhūyo 'nyaj jñātavyam avaśhiṣhyate ||
slokas.meaning: I shall now declare unto you in full this knowledge, both phenomenal and numinous. This being known, nothing further shall remain for you to know.

slokas.sanskrit: मनुष्याणां सहस्रेषु कश्चिद्यतति सिद्धये | यततामपि सिद्धानां कश्चिन्मां वेत्ति तत्त्वतः ||
slokas.pronunciation: manuṣhyāṇāṁ sahasreṣhu kaśhchid yatati siddhaye | yatatām api siddhānāṁ kaśhchin māṁ vetti tattvataḥ ||
slokas.meaning: Among thousands of men, one may endeavor for perfection, and of those who have achieved perfection, hardly one knows Me in truth.

slokas.sanskrit: भूमिरापोऽनलो वायुः खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च | अहङ्कार इतीयं मे भिन्ना प्रकृतिरष्टधा ||
slokas.pronunciation: bhūmir āpo 'nalo vāyuḥ khaṁ mano buddhir eva cha | ahankāra itīyaṁ me bhinnā prakṛitir aṣhṭadhā ||
slokas.meaning: Earth, water, fire, air, ether, mind, intelligence and false ego – these eight comprise My separated material energies.

slokas.sanskrit: अपरेयमितस्त्वन्यां प्रकृतिं विद्धि मे पराम् | जीवभूतां महाबाहो ययेदं धार्यते जगत् ||
slokas.pronunciation: apareyam itas tvanyāṁ prakṛitiṁ viddhi me parām | jīva-bhūtāṁ mahā-bāho yayedaṁ dhāryate jagat ||
slokas.meaning: Besides these, O mighty-armed one, there is another, superior energy of Mine, which comprises the living entities who are exploiting the resources of this material, inferior nature.

slokas.sanskrit: एतद्योनीनि भूतानि सर्वाणीत्युपधारय | अहं कृत्स्नस्य जगतः प्रभवः प्रलयस्तथा ||
slokas.pronunciation: etad-yonīni bhūtāni sarvāṇītyupadhāraya | ahaṁ kṛitsnasya jagataḥ prabhavaḥ pralayas tathā ||
slokas.meaning: Know that all beings are born of these two natures. I am both the origin and dissolution of the entire cosmos.

slokas.sanskrit: मत्तः परतरं नान्यत्किञ्चिदस्ति धनञ्जय | मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव ||
slokas.pronunciation: mattaḥ parataraṁ nānyat kiñchid asti dhanañjaya | mayi sarvam idaṁ protaṁ sūtre maṇi-gaṇā iva ||
slokas.meaning: O conqueror of wealth (Arjuna), there is nothing superior to Me. Everything rests upon Me, as pearls are strung on a thread.

slokas.sanskrit: रसोऽहमप्सु कौन्तेय प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययोः | प्रणवः सर्ववेदेषु शब्दः खे पौरुषं नृषु ||
slokas.pronunciation: raso 'ham apsu kaunteya prabhāsmi śhaśhi-sūryayoḥ | praṇavaḥ sarva-vedeṣhu śhabdaḥ khe pauruṣhaṁ nṛiṣhu ||
slokas.meaning: O son of Kunti, I am the taste of water, the light of the sun and the moon, the syllable Om in the Vedic mantras; I am the sound in ether and ability in man.

slokas.sanskrit: पुण्यो गन्धः पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभावसौ | जीवनं सर्वभूतेषु तपश्चास्मि तपस्विषु ||
slokas.pronunciation: puṇyo gandhaḥ pṛithivyāṁ cha tejaśh chāsmi vibhāvasau | jīvanaṁ sarva-bhūteṣhu tapaśh chāsmi tapasviṣhu ||
slokas.meaning: I am the original fragrance of the earth, and I am the heat in fire. I am the life of all that lives, and I am the penances of all ascetics.

slokas.sanskrit: बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम् | बुद्धिर्बुद्धिमतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: bījaṁ māṁ sarva-bhūtānāṁ viddhi pārtha sanātanam | buddhir buddhimatām asmi tejas tejasvinām aham ||
slokas.meaning: O son of Pritha, know that I am the original seed of all existences, the intelligence of the intelligent, and the prowess of all powerful men.

slokas.sanskrit: बलं बलवतां चाहं कामरागविवर्जितम् | धर्माविरुद्धो भूतेषु कामोऽस्मि भरतर्षभ ||
slokas.pronunciation: balaṁ balavatāṁ chāhaṁ kāma-rāga-vivarjitam | dharmāviruddho bhūteṣhu kāmo 'smi bharatarṣhabha ||
slokas.meaning: I am the strength of the strong, devoid of passion and desire. I am desire in living beings that is not contrary to dharma, O best of the Bharatas (Arjuna).

slokas.sanskrit: ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च ये | मत्त एवेति तान्विद्धि न त्वहं तेषु ते मयि ||
slokas.pronunciation: ye chaiva sāttvikā bhāvā rājasās tāmasāśh cha ye | matta eveti tān viddhi na tvahaṁ teṣhu te mayi ||
slokas.meaning: Know that all states of being – be they of goodness, passion or ignorance – are manifested from My energy. I am, in one sense, everything, but I am independent. I am not under the modes of material nature, for they, on the contrary, are within Me.

slokas.sanskrit: त्रिभिर्गुणमयैर्भावैरेभिः सर्वमिदं जगत् | मोहितं नाभिजानाति मामेभ्यः परमव्ययम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: tribhir guṇa-mayair bhāvair ebhiḥ sarvam idaṁ jagat | mohitaṁ nābhijānāti mām ebhyaḥ param avyayam ||
slokas.meaning: Deluded by the three modes [goodness, passion and ignorance], the whole world does not know Me, who am above the modes and inexhaustible.

slokas.sanskrit: दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया | मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते ||
slokas.pronunciation: daivī hy eṣhā guṇa-mayī mama māyā duratyayā | mām eva ye prapadyante māyām etāṁ taranti te ||
slokas.meaning: This divine energy of Mine, consisting of the three modes of material nature, is difficult to overcome. But those who have surrendered unto Me can easily cross beyond it.

slokas.sanskrit: न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढाः प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमाः | माययापहृतज्ञाना आसुरं भावमाश्रिताः ||
slokas.pronunciation: na māṁ duṣhkṛitino mūḍhāḥ prapadyante narādhamāḥ | māyayāpahṛita-jñānā āsuraṁ bhāvam āśhritāḥ ||
slokas.meaning: Those miscreants who are grossly foolish, who are lowest among mankind, whose knowledge is stolen by illusion, and who partake of the atheistic nature of demons do not surrender unto Me.

slokas.sanskrit: चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जनाः सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन | आर्तो जिज्ञासुरर्थार्थी ज्ञानी च भरतर्षभ ||
slokas.pronunciation: chatur-vidhā bhajante māṁ janāḥ sukṛitino 'rjuna | ārto jijñāsur arthārthī jñānī cha bharatarṣhabha ||
slokas.meaning: O best among the Bharatas (Arjuna), four kinds of pious people render devotional service unto Me: the distressed, the seeker of knowledge, the seeker of wealth, and the wise.

slokas.sanskrit: तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्तिर्विशिष्यते | प्रियो हि ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रियः ||
slokas.pronunciation: teṣhāṁ jñānī nitya-yukta eka-bhaktir viśhiṣhyate | priyo hi jñānino 'tyartham ahaṁ sa cha mama priyaḥ ||
slokas.meaning: Of these, the wise one who is in full knowledge in union with Me through pure devotional service is the best. For I am very dear to him, and he is dear to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: उदाराः सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मतम् | आस्थितः स हि युक्तात्मा मामेवानुत्तमां गतिम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: udārāḥ sarva evaite jñānī tvātmaiva me matam | āsthitaḥ sa hi yuktātmā mām evānuttamāṁ gatim ||
slokas.meaning: All these devotees are undoubtedly magnanimous souls, but he who is situated in knowledge of Me I consider to be just like My own self. Being engaged in My transcendental service, he is sure to attain Me, the highest and most perfect goal.

slokas.sanskrit: बहूनां जन्मनामन्ते ज्ञानवान्मां प्रपद्यते | वासुदेवः सर्वमिति स महात्मा सुदुर्लभः ||
slokas.pronunciation: bahūnāṁ janmanām ante jñānavān māṁ prapadyate | vāsudevaḥ sarvam iti sa mahātmā su-durlabhaḥ ||
slokas.meaning: After many births and deaths, he who is actually in knowledge surrenders unto Me, knowing Me to be the cause of all causes and all that is. Such a great soul is very rare.

slokas.sanskrit: कामैस्तैस्तैर्हृतज्ञानाः प्रपद्यन्तेऽन्यदेवताः | तं तं नियममास्थाय प्रकृत्या नियताः स्वया ||
slokas.pronunciation: kāmais tais tair hṛita-jñānāḥ prapadyante 'nya-devatāḥ | taṁ taṁ niyamam āsthāya prakṛityā niyatāḥ svayā ||
slokas.meaning: Those whose intelligence has been stolen by material desires surrender unto demigods and follow the particular rules and regulations of worship according to their own natures.

slokas.sanskrit: यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्तः श्रद्धयार्चितुमिच्छति | तस्य तस्याचलां श्रद्धां तामेव विदधाम्यहम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: yo yo yāṁ yāṁ tanuṁ bhaktaḥ śhraddhayārchitum ichchhati | tasya tasyāchalāṁ śhraddhāṁ tām eva vidadhāmyaham ||
slokas.meaning: I am in everyone's heart as the Supersoul. As soon as one desires to worship some demigod, I make his faith steady so that he can devote himself to that particular deity.

slokas.sanskrit: स तया श्रद्धया युक्तस्तस्याराधनमीहते | लभते च ततः कामान्मयैव विहितान्हि तान् ||
slokas.pronunciation: sa tayā śhraddhayā yuktas tasyārādhanam īhate | labhate cha tataḥ kāmān mayaiva vihitān hi tān ||
slokas.meaning: Endowed with such faith, he seeks the worship of a particular demigod and obtains his desires. But in reality these benefits are bestowed by Me alone.

slokas.sanskrit: अन्तवत्तु फलं तेषां तद्भवत्यल्पमेधसाम् | देवान्देवयजो यान्ति मद्भक्ता यान्ति मामपि ||
slokas.pronunciation: antavat tu phalaṁ teṣhāṁ tad bhavatyalpa-medhasām | devān deva-yajo yānti mad-bhaktā yānti mām api ||
slokas.meaning: Men of small intelligence worship the demigods, and their fruits are limited and temporary. Those who worship the demigods go to the demigods, but My devotees come to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: अव्यक्तं व्यक्तिमापन्नं मन्यन्ते मामबुद्धयः | परं भावमजानन्तो ममाव्ययमनुत्तमम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: avyaktaṁ vyaktim āpannaṁ manyante mām abuddhayaḥ | paraṁ bhāvam ajānanto mamāvyayam anuttamam ||
slokas.meaning: Unintelligent men, who do not know Me perfectly, think that I, the Supreme Personality of Godhead, Krishna, was impersonal before and have now assumed this personality. Due to their small knowledge, they do not know My higher nature, which is imperishable and supreme.

slokas.sanskrit: नाहं प्रकाशः सर्वस्य योगमायासमावृतः | मूढोऽयं नाभिजानाति लोको मामजमव्ययम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: nāhaṁ prakāśhaḥ sarvasya yoga-māyā-samāvṛitaḥ | mūḍho 'yaṁ nābhijānāti loko mām ajam avyayam ||
slokas.meaning: I am never manifest to the foolish and unintelligent. For them I am covered by My internal potency, and therefore they do not know that I am unborn and infallible.

slokas.sanskrit: वेदाहं समतीतानि वर्तमानानि चार्जुन | भविष्याणि च भूतानि मां तु वेद न कश्चन ||
slokas.pronunciation: vedāhaṁ samatītāni vartamānāni chārjuna | bhaviṣhyāṇi cha bhūtāni māṁ tu veda na kaśhchana ||
slokas.meaning: O Arjuna, as the Supreme Personality of Godhead, I know everything that has happened in the past, all that is happening in the present, and all things that are yet to come. I also know all living entities; but Me no one knows.

slokas.sanskrit: इच्छाद्वेषसमुत्थेन द्वन्द्वमोहेन भारत | सर्वभूतानि सम्मोहं सर्गे यान्ति परन्तप ||
slokas.pronunciation: ichchhā-dveṣha-samutthena dvandva-mohena bhārata | sarva-bhūtāni sammohaṁ sarge yānti parantapa ||
slokas.meaning: O scion of Bharata, O conqueror of the foe, all living entities are born into delusion, bewildered by dualities arisen from desire and hate.

slokas.sanskrit: येषां त्वन्तगतं पापं जनानां पुण्यकर्मणाम् | ते द्वन्द्वमोहनिर्मुक्ता भजन्ते मां दृढव्रताः ||
slokas.pronunciation: yeṣhāṁ tvanta-gataṁ pāpaṁ janānāṁ puṇya-karmaṇām | te dvandva-moha-nirmuktā bhajante māṁ dṛiḍha-vratāḥ ||
slokas.meaning: Persons who have acted piously in previous lives and in this life and whose sinful actions are completely eradicated are freed from the dualities of delusion, and they engage themselves in My service with determination.

slokas.sanskrit: जरामरणमोक्षाय मामाश्रित्य यतन्ति ये | ते ब्रह्म तद्विदुः कृत्स्नमध्यात्मं कर्म चाखिलम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: jarā-maraṇa-mokṣhāya mām āśhritya yatanti ye | te brahma tadviduḥ kṛitsnam adhyātmaṁ karma chākhilam ||
slokas.meaning: Intelligent persons who are endeavoring for liberation from old age and death take refuge in Me in devotional service. They are actually Brahman because they entirely know everything about transcendental activities.

slokas.sanskrit: साधिभूताधिदैवं मां साधियज्ञं च ये विदुः | प्रयाणकालेऽपि च मां ते विदुर्युक्तचेतसः ||
slokas.pronunciation: sādhibhūtādhidaivaṁ māṁ sādhiyajñaṁ cha ye viduḥ | prayāṇa-kāle 'pi cha māṁ te vidur yukta-chetasaḥ ||
slokas.meaning: Those in full consciousness of Me, who know Me as the governing principle of the material manifestation, of the demigods, and of all methods of sacrifice, can understand and know Me, the Supreme Personality of Godhead, even at the time of death.
